title.narrative: 105 HPS POLICIES, PROCEDURES, TOOLS

description.narrative: 105 HPSPolicies procedures, tools, systems and practices are in place that strengthen UNICEF's humanitarian action, preparedness and response, work in fragile states and building resilience., which contributes to Saving Lives And Protecting Rights In Humanitarian Situations, Technical Excellence In Humanitarian Action. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Timely, effective and reliable support is provided to country and regional offices to save lives and protect rights in humanitarian situations and to strengthen resilience

related-activity.ref: 456F/F0/09/100 TIMELY, EFFECTIVE AND RELIABLE SUPPORT I

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 105 HPSPolicies procedures, tools, systems and practices are in place that strengthen UNICEF?s humanitarian action, preparednessand response, work in fragile states and building resilience.

description.narrative: Efforts in the lead-up and following the World Humanitarian Summit included continued focus on emerging areas of humanitarian programming (cash-based approaches, accountability to affected populations, return on investment, programming in urban contexts), cross-cutting issues (gender), strengthened humanitarian-development programming and in complex high threat environments (Programme Criticality and NSE engagement). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2017

title.narrative: CO / RO support missions, and remote support activities to COs/ ROs

baseline.value: 12 instances of support missions in 2014 , Almost all requests were supported via teleconferences, webinar or issue papers

target.value: 2016:At least 10 COs/ROs to be supported via missions. Minimum 80% of remote support requests.

actual.value: 2016:Provided on demand support to COs and ROs on working in complex and high threat environments Two CO support missions (Iraq, Ukraine, South Sudan, Thailand/Myanmar). At least 80% of remote support requests were fulfilled.

title.narrative: Support EMOPS particiaption in UNWGT, Integration Working Group and related policy for a. Support and guidance provided to COs undergoing mission transitions. Coordinate design of orientation package and program of learning for Reps in complex and high threat, and integrated contexts. Support engagement with the QCPR, humanitarian reform and SDG related processes.

baseline.value: Actively participated in system-wide integration discussions, Technical Guidance developed. Tools/references outdated/in draft.

target.value: 2016:Active particiation in UNWGT and peace and security discussions, UNICEF COs feel well-equipped to function in a variety of operational contexts, global leadership is informed of ongoing reforms, UNICE

actual.value: 2016:EMOPS participated to UNWGT and IASC Task Team on Humanitarian-Development Nexus, Integrated Analysis and Planning Working Group and related policy fora. Support and guidance was provided to COs undergoing reviews of missions' mandates or strategic assessment and planning processes in South Sudan, S

title.narrative: CHTE Guidance updated and disseminated, A revised NSE guidance note under guidance of the established reference group

baseline.value: CHTE Guidance on NSE engagement, Civil Military engagement, IHL, sanctions, use of UAVs by UNICEF updated and disseminated , NSE guidance is to be revised based on the changes in the typology of NSE

target.value: 2016:Updated and disseminated guidance and policy papers (at least three RO/CO trainings and action planning in MENA)

actual.value: 2016:Finalization of NSE Engagement Guidance and Field Manual ongoing (to be finalized Q1 2017), COs/ROs were provided timely remote policy support and guidance vis-a-vis NSE engagement, CivMil engagement, IHL, Sanctions, use of UaVs, remote programming.

title.narrative: Training programme delivered, related guidance produced, strategic and technical partnerships strengthened, Timely and efficient management of project activities, including 4 trainings at the CO level

baseline.value: Field mission s completed, initail guidance developed, training modalities and scope agreed, Trainings under development

target.value: 2016:Guidance package widely available and utilized, sector specific use of cash improved, 4 trainings successfully implemented

actual.value: 2016:Training was completed by MENARO, with EMOPS support. An inter-divisional group made up of EMOPS, programme division, the public partnership division, the division of administration and finance, has come together to agree on a common UNICEF approach to cash. This group is working to put forward a co

title.narrative: Gap analysis completed for humanitarian action in urban contexts

baseline.value: No analysis exists, no CoP, limited tools/guidance

target.value: 2016:Gap analysis completed, feeds into global strategy on urban contexts

actual.value: 2016:Reviewed the global urban mapping conducted by PD and technical inputs provided to development of Urban Strategic Framework to reflect humanitarian aspects.

title.narrative: Inter-agency support missions to UN Country Teams Training of Trainers in PC Secretariat support to PCSC and PCCT (to be concluded in Q1)

baseline.value: Secretariat support to PCCT and PCSC, including in preparation of the Policy Committee meeting on Programme Criticality, PC support missions: Kenya, South Sudan, PC ToTs were facilitated in Addis and

target.value: 2016:100% response rate to country level mission support requets (or remote support - in case mission is not feasible), 2 PC support missions, Timely and efficient support to PCSG and PCCT (in Q1), 1 PC To

actual.value: 2016:100% response rate achieved through country-level missions or remote support. 11 COs (Afghanistan, Ethiopia, Iraq, Mali, Niger, Nigeria, South Sudan, Sudan, Syria, Tajikistan, Yemen) provided remote support on PC. Two PC support mission undertaken (incl. one PCA mission (Iraq), and follow-up disc

title.narrative: Dialogue held and conclusions documented for further action and dissemination

baseline.value: Semi-Finalized non-paper on Risk Management, IASC Work Stream on Risk Management developed a paper on risk management concepts among humanitarian organizations

target.value: 2016:Enhanced dialogue and sharing of issues, concerns, challenges and best practices on risk management among humanitarian organizations

actual.value: 2016:No dialogue took place due to staff member early departure.

title.narrative: Coordinate SHA follow-up and complete remaining SHA outcomes - CCCs updated/expanded and operational benchmarks added, decisions are implemented in areas led by other divisions (human resources, partnerships etc), support implementation of CEAP/SSOPs (L3, L2 others) including webinars/direct support to COs/ROs and development of new guidances/briefs as required

baseline.value: Short/medium term actions completed., L3 SSOP revised and addendum on application of SSOP on protracted emergencies is issued.

target.value: 2016:All SHA follow-up actions, except update of EPR training, completed by mid-2016., L3/2 SSOPs and briefs/tools updated on a rolling bases (L3 SSOP in Q3), Developed training module on CEAP/L3 SSOP deve

actual.value: 2016:SHA follow-up was coordinated and remaining SHA outcomes completed: CCCs updated/expanded and operational benchmarks added, decisions = implemented in areas led by other divisions (human resources, partnerships etc), supported implementation of CEAP/SSOPs (L3, L2 others) including webinars/direct su

title.narrative: Participation in annual face-to-face meeting of the IASC Gender in Humanitarian Action Reference Group

actual.value: 2016:Participated in Annual Gender in Humanitarian Action meeting with key outputs being contribution in updating the IASC Gender Handbook, participation in updating the gender policy statement and developing the accountability framework, participation in 2016 ECOSOC HAS on Gender Equality and Women's E

title.narrative: Two research pieces identifying best practice and lessons, increasing UNICEF's ability to programme effectively for these groups in crisis situations

actual.value: 2016:ROI methodology refined and rolled out in three additional pilot countries: Myanmar, Niger, Uganda. Carbon savings methodology completed. Final report on schedule for end January 2017. Learning has been collected and project website updated throughout year.

title.narrative: Time & money return on investment model expanded, preparedness-derived carbon savings calculations performed, IA climate change capacity development, knowledge generation and exchange

baseline.value: UNICEF has implemented ROI model in three pilot country. No carbon costing data exists.

target.value: 2016:by end 2016, UNICEF to complete ROI model for three additional pilot countries and analyze results for strategic insights, preparedness carbon savings ratios calculated, climate learning strategy impl

actual.value: 2017:ROI methodology refined and rolled out in three additional pilot countries: Myanmar, Niger, Uganda. Carbon savings methodology completed. Final report on schedule for end January 2017. Learning has been collected and project website updated throughout year.
